name: Video Storage & Recording
description: Sector template for video storage and recording patents including DVR, cloud DVR, time-shifting, and video asset management.
contextDescription: Video storage patents cover recording, time-shifting, and asset management for video content. Key areas include DVR (local and network), cloud DVR, trick-play (fast-forward, rewind), storage optimization, and video asset management systems. Targets include pay-TV operators, cloud DVR providers, and consumer electronics manufacturers.
scoringGuidance: Cloud DVR patents are high value as pay-TV shifts recording to the cloud.
Network DVR patents addressing 'copy once' vs 'copy many' have regulatory implications.
Trick-play optimization patents (thumbnail generation, I-frame seeking) have broad applicability.
Storage efficiency patents (deduplication, tiered storage) reduce operator costs.
Patents enabling 'Start Over' and 'Catch Up' TV features are strategically valuable.

questions.question: What storage architecture does this patent address? Score 1-3 for local/device storage, 4-6 for network/operator storage, 7-10 for cloud DVR or hybrid cloud-local.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify storage location: local HDD/SSD, network DVR, cloud, or hybrid architectures.

questions.question: What recording capabilities does this patent enable? Score 1-3 for basic recording, 4-6 for scheduled/series recording, 7-10 for advanced (whole-channel, predictive, cloud-based).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess recording sophistication: manual, scheduled, series, recommendation-based, whole-channel.

questions.question: Does this patent address trick-play or video navigation? Score 1-3 if not applicable, 4-6 for basic FF/REW, 7-10 for advanced (thumbnail preview, scene detection, variable speed).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Trick-play UX is differentiating. Assess innovation in navigation and preview.

questions.question: Does this patent optimize storage efficiency? Score 1-3 if not applicable, 4-6 for basic compression, 7-10 for advanced (deduplication, tiered storage, intelligent retention).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Storage costs are significant for operators. Assess efficiency improvements.

questions.question: Does this patent enable time-shifting features? Score 1-3 for playback-only, 4-6 for pause/resume live, 7-10 for Start Over, Catch Up, or restart from beginning.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Time-shifting features are premium differentiators. Assess feature scope.
